ا alif is the first letter of the Puś̱ẖto, as also of the Arabic, Hebrew, Persian, and other oriental alphabets; and its powers are precisely the same as in those languages, with which the student of Puś̱ẖto is supposed to be in some measure acquainted. The Afg̠ẖān authors do not make much difference between ا and (ــَــ), and they are often interchanged one for the other, particularly in the vocative case. According to the Arabian system of substituting letters for figures, known as the abjad, the letter ا stands for ʻone.ʼ Placed between two nouns, as in the Persian, it denotes continuity, conjunction, or proximity; as, مخامخ maḵẖā-maḵẖ, Face to face; ورڅا ورڅ wraḏẕā-wraḏẕ, Every day.
A اب ab, s.m. (9th) Father, master, possessor. Sing. and Pl. See پلار

P آب āb, s.m. (9th) Water; character, honor, reputation, lustre, etc. Sing. and Pl. It is only used in composition; as, آب و ادب āb-o-adab, Courtesy, politeness; آب حیوان āb-i-ḥaiwān, or آب حیات āb-i-ḥaiyāt, The water of life or immortality; آب رو āb-rū, or آب روي āb-rū-e, The water of the face; reputation, renown, honor, lustre; or دَ مخ آب da maḵẖ āb; بي آب َ کول be āba kawul, verb trans. To dishonor, to disgrace, to lower in the estimation of another; بي آبَ کیدل be āba kedal, verb intrans. To become dishonored or disgraced.
ابا abā, A word of endearment to a father.
A ابا ibā, s.f. (6th) Denial, refusal. (E.) Sing. and Pl. (W.) Pl. اباوي ibāwī. ابا کول ibā kawul, verb trans. To refuse, to deny; or ابا راوړل ibā rā-wʿṟṟal.
A ابابکر abā-bakr, or ابوبکر abū-bakr, s. prop. The name of the first Ḵẖalīfah.
A ابابیل abā-bīl, s.m. (2nd) The swallow. Pl. ابابیلونه abā-bīlūnah.

A اباحتي abā-ḥatī, s.m. (5th) The name of a sect of Muḥammadans who maintain that the law and good works are of no avail. Pl. اباحتیان abāḥatī-ān. ابا حتئِي abāḥataʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the above sect. Sing. and Pl. Also called ابا حتیه abā-ḥatīaʿh.
اباخیل abā-ḵẖel, s.m. (6th) The name of a tribe of Afg̠ẖāns. Sing. and Pl. ابا خیله abā-ḵẖelaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A female of the above. Pl. يْ ey.

P آباد ābād, adj. Cultivated, populous, inhabited, prosperous, thriving; (Fem.) آباده ābādaʿh. آباد کیدل ābād kedal, verb intrans. To become cultivated, inhabited, prosperous; آباد کول ābād kawul, verb trans. To cultivate, to people, to make or render prosperous.
P آبادي ābādī, s.f. (3rd) or آباداني ābādānī, s.f. (3rd) Population, cultivation, abundance, prosperity. Pl. ئِ‍ي aʿī. See ودان and وداني
ابازي abā-zī, s.m. (1st) Pl. The name of a tribe of Afg̠ẖāns. ابازيَ abā-zaey, Sing. A male of the Abā-zī tribe. ابازئي abā-zaʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the above. Sing. and Pl.
اباسین abā-sīn, or ابا سیند abā-sīnd, s. prop. The Father of Rivers--the Afg̠ẖān name for the Indus (from A ابا ʻfatherʼ, and S سین or سیند ʻa riverʼ).
A ابتدا ibtidā, s.f. (6th) Beginning, commencement. (E.) Sing. and Pl. (W.) Pl. ابتداوي ibtidā-wī. ابتدا کول ibtidā kawul, verb trans. To begin, to commence.
A ابتر abtar, adj. Ruined, spoiled, worthless; dissolute, wanton (from بتر destitute of a tail; H /?/ cut short); (Fem.) ابتره abtaraʿh; ابتر کول abtar kawul, verb trans. To spoil, to ruin. See اوتر
ابتري abtarī, s.f. (3rd) Worthlessness, wantonness. Pl. ئِي aʿī.
A ابد abad, s.m. (9th) Eternity, without end. Sing. and Pl. ته ابدَ tah abada, تر ابدَ tar abada, تر ابدَ بورِ tah abada pori, or پوري porī, For ever and ever, to all eternity.
P آبدار ābdār, adj. Watery, moist. 2. Glancing as a gem or sword. 3. Sharp, dazzling; (Fem.) آبداره ābdāraʿh.
A ابدال abdāl, s.m. (5th) A saint, a devotee. Pl. ابدالان abdālān.

ابدالي abdālī, s.m. (1st) Pl. The name of one of the great divisions or septs of the Afg̠ẖāns, of which Aḥmad S̱ẖāh, the first king of Afg̠ẖānistān, was the hereditary chieftain. ابداليَ abdālaey, Sing. A male of the above. ابدالئِي abdālaʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the tribe. Sing. and Pl. Also written اودالي and اودل, which see.
A ابدي abadī or ابدا ً abadaṇ, adj. Eternal, without end.
P ابر abr, s.m. (9th) Clouds. Sing. and Pl. See اوربڅ
A ابرار abrār, adj. (s. Pl. A) Holy, just, pious.
A ابراهیم ibrāhīm, s. prop. The patriarch Abraham. 2. A man's name.
P ابرو ab-rū, s.m. (5th) The eyebrow. Pl. ابروان ab-rū-ān. See ورڅه

P آبرو āb-rū, s.m. (9th) Honour, reputation, character, renown, good name. Sing. and Pl. آبرو تویول āb-rū to-yawul, verb trans. To disgrace, to dishonor, to take away one's character or reputation. آبرو ورکول āb-rū war- kawul, verb trans. To honor, to treat with respect or distinction.
P ابره abraʿh, s.f. (3rd) The outer cloth of a double garment. 2. A small shawl worn round the waist. Pl. يْ ey.
ابرئِِي ub-ṟṟaʿī, s.f. (6th) Green vegetation at the bottom of pools or cisterns. Sing. and Pl.
P آبشار āb-s̱ẖār, s.m. (2nd) A cascade, a cataract, a waterfall. Pl. آبشارونه āb-s̱ẖārūnah.
A آبق ābiḳ, s.m. (5th) A runaway slave. Pl. آبقان ābiḳān. آبقه ābiḳaʿh, s.f. (3rd) The feminine of the above. Pl. يْ ey.

A ابلاغ ib-lāg̠ẖ, s.m. (2nd) Informing, converging, aiming at, obtaining an end, causing to arrive, sending. Pl. ابلاغونه ib-lāg̠ẖūnah. ابلاغ کول ib-lāg̠ẖ kawul, verb trans. To inform, to make aware of, to acquaint.
ابل abl, adj. Bare, barefooted, unshod; (Fem.) ابله ablaʿh. ابليْ ښپيْ ab-ley ḵ́ẖpey (E.), or ابليْ پښيْ abley pś̱ẖey (W.), Barefooted. See یبله
A ابلق ab-laḳ, adj. Piebald, black and white, party-coloured; (Fem.) ابلقه ablaḳaʿh.
ابلک ablak, adj. (Fem.) ابلکه ablakaʿh, Corruption of preceding.
A ابله ablah, adj. Foolish, silly, a fool; (Fem.) ابلهه ab-lahaʿh. ابلهي ab-lahī, s.f. (3rd) Foolishness, silliness, simplicity. Pl. ئِي aʿī.
A ابلیس ib-līs, s. prop. The devil.
A ابن ibn, s.m. (9th) A son. Sing. and Pl.
P آبنوس āb-nūs, s.m. (6th) Ebony. Sing. and Pl. آبنوسي āb-nūsī, adj. Made of ebony.
A ابو abū, s.m. (9th) Father. Sing. and Pl. Used as a prefix to proper names; as ابوبکر abū-bakr, The father-in-law of Muḥammad, and his successor.

P آبوتاب āb-o-tāb, or آبتاب āb-tāb, s.m. (2nd) Splendor, lustre, honor. Pl. آبوتابونه āb-o-tābūnah, or آبتابونه āb-tābūnah. بي آبوتابَ کول bey āb-o-tāba kawul, verb trans. To disgrace, to dishonor, to lower.
P آبي ā-bī, or ابي abī, adj. Watery, blue-coloured. 2. Moist, aqueous.
ابئِي abaʿī, A title of endearment for a mother. See ادي
A ابیات ab-yāt, s. (Pl. of بیت) Houses. 2. Verses.
ابیر abīr, s.m. (6th) corrup. of عبیر) Ambergris. Sing. and Pl.
آپرین ā-prīn, interj. Bravo! well done! 2. s.m. (2nd) Praise, applause, approbation. Pl. آپرینونه ā-prīnūnah. آپرین ویل ā-prīn wa-yal, verb trans. To praise, to applaud. See آفرین

اپریدي aprī-dī, s.m. (1st) Pl. The name of a tribe of Afg̠ẖāns who are the pest of the Peś̱ẖāwer district. اپریديَ aprī-daey, Sing. A male of the above tribe. اپریدئِي aprī-daʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the above. Sing. and Pl. Also written افریدي
ابس دندئِي a-pas ḏḏanḏḏaʿī, s.f. (6th) The game of cat and dog, tip-cat. Sing. and Pl.
اپلاس ip-lās, s.m. (2nd) (corrup. of A افلاس) Poverty, penury, indigence, bankruptcy. Pl. اپلاسونه ip-lāsūnah.
اپلت ap-lat, adj. Low, obscene, dirty, filthy; (Fem.) اپلته ap-lataʿh. اپلتي خبري ap-latey ḵẖabarey, s.f. (3rd) Pl. Low or obscene language.
اپوته a-pūṯṯœh, adj. Disturbed, troubled; (Fem.) اپوته a-pūṯṯaʿh.
اتبار it-bār, s.m. (9th) Sunday. Sing. and Pl. (S اتوار)
اترنک at-rang, s.m. (6th) The name of a plant used in dyeing. Sing. and Pl.

P آتش ā-tas̱ẖ, s.m. (9th) Fire. Sing. and Pl. Used only in composition, as آتش بازي ā-tas̱ẖ bāzī, s.f. (3rd) Fire-works. Pl. ئِي aʿī. اتش پرست ā-tas̱ẖ parast, s.m. (5th) A worshipper of fire, a Gabr, one of the Māgī, a Pārsī. Pl. آتش پرستان ā-tas̱ẖ-parastān. آتش پرسته ā-tas̱ẖ-parastaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A female Gabr. Pl. يْ ey. آتش پرستي ā-tas̱ẖ-parastī, s.f. (3rd) The worship of fire. Pl. ئِي aʿī. آتس خانه ā-tas̱ẖ ḵẖānaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A fireplace; the part of a matchlock where the charge is placed. Pl. يْ ey. آتش کده ā-tas̱ẖ kadaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A grate, a fireplace; a temple of fire-worshippers. Pl. يْ ey. See اور
P آتشک ā-tas̱ẖak, s.m. (9th) The venereal disease. Sing. and Pl.
P آتش ګیر ā-tas̱ẖ gīr, s.m. (6th) Tinder. Sing. and Pl.
P آتشي ā-tas̱ẖī, adj. Fiery, hot, irascible; sensual.
آتشي ښیښه ā-tas̱ẖī ś̱ẖīś̱ẖaʿh (W.) or ḵ́ẖīḵ́ẖaʿh (E.) s.f. (3rd) A burning glass. Pl. يْ ey. (P شیشه)
A اتعاظ iti-œāz̤, s.m. (9th) Admonition, advice, admonishing, receiving admonition. Sing. and Pl. اتعاظ کول iti-œāz̤ kawul, verb trans. To admonish, to advise.

A اتفاق itta-fāḳ, s.m. (2nd) Concord, agreement, agreeing, consenting. Pl. اتفاقونه itta-fāḳūnah. په اتفاق سره pah itta-fāḳ sarah, By chance, accidentally; or اتفاقاً itta-fāḳan. اتقاق کیدل itta-fāḳ kedal, verb intrans. To happen, to befal; to be agreed. اتفاق کول itta-fāḳ kawul, verb trans. To agree, to consent, to concur; to conspire; to happen.
A اتفاتي itta-fāḳī, adj. Accidental, casual, fortuitous. 2. Agreeing, concurring.
A اتقيٰ at-ḳā, adj. More, or most pious.
A اتکا itti-kā, s.f. (6th) Leaning against, reclining upon, trusting to, confiding in. (E.) Sing. and Pl. (W.) Pl. اتکاوي itti-kāwī. اتکا کول itti-kā kawul, verb trans. To trust to, to confide in.
اتلس at-las, s.m. (2nd) (corrup. of A اطلس), Satin. Pl. اتلسونه at-lasūnah.
اتم atam, adj. (from اته eight) The eighth; (Fem.) اتمه atamaʿh.

A اتمام it-mām, s.m. (9th) Completing, perfecting, accomplishing. Sing. and Pl. اتمام کيدل it-mām kedal, verb intrans. To become perfected, completed. اتمام کول it-mām kawul, verb trans. To complete, to perfect, to accomplish.
اتمان خيل ut-mān-ḵẖel, s.m. (6th) The name of a tribe of Afg̠ẖāns. Sing. and Pl. اتمان خیله ut-mān ḵẖelaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A female of the above. Pl. يْ ey.

اتمان څي ut-mān-ḏẕī, s.m. (1st) Pl. The name also given to the preceding Afg̠ẖān tribe. اتمان څيَ ut-mān-ḏẕaey, Sing. A male of the tribe. اتما څئِي ut-mān-ḏẕaʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the above. Sing. and Pl.
اتنر a-taṟṟṉ, s.m. (2nd) A kind of dance. Pl. اتنرونه a-taṟṟṉūnah. Also written اتنراتن وهل a-taṟṟṉ wahal, or اتنر آچول a-taṟṟṉ āc̱ẖawul, verb trans. To dance the a-taṟṟṉ.
S اتوار it-wār, s.m. (9th) Sunday. Sing. and Pl.
اتوب a-tūb, s.m. (2nd) A dish made from flour, sugar, and butter. Pl. اتوبونه a-tūbūnah.
اتوزي ato-zī, s.m. (1st) Pl. The name of an Afg̠ẖān tribe. اتوزيَ ato-zaey, Sing. A male of the tribe. اتوزئِي ato-zaʿī, s.f. (6th) A female of the above. Sing. and Pl.

اته a-tah, adj. Eight; اتم atam, The eighth; (Fem.) اتمه atamaʿh. اته لس a-tah-las, Eighteen; اته ويشت a-tah-wīs̱ẖt, Twenty-eight; اته ديرش a-tah-ders̱ẖ, Thirty-eight; اته څلويښت a-tah-ṯs̱al-weś̱ẖt (W.) or ṯs̱al-weḵ́ẖt (E.) Forty-eight; اته پنڅوس a-tah-pīn-ḏẕos, Fifty-eight; اته شپيته a-tah-s̱ẖpe- tah, Sixty-eight; اته اويا a-tah-aw-yā, Seventy-eight; اته اتيا a-tah at-yā, Eighty-eight; اته نوي a-tah nawī, Ninety-eight.
اتيا at-yā, adj. Eighty; اتيايم at-yāyam, The eightieth; (Fem.) اتيايمه at-yāyamaʿh.
اټال a-ṯṯāl, adj. Unemployed, out of place; (Fem.) اټاله a-ṯṯālaʿh.
اټک aṯṯak, s. prop. The name of a town on the Indus, the river Indus. (From HI اٿک hinderance, bar, obstruction.)

I اټکل aṯṯ-kal, s.m. (2nd) Guess, conjecture, judgment. Pl. اټکلونه aṯṯ-ḳalūnah اټکلول aṯṯ-kalawul, verb trans. To guess, to conjecture, to judge, to think, to estimate. Pres. اټکلوي aṯṯ-kalawī; past ؤاټکلاوه wu-aṯṯ-kalāwuh or ؤ اټکلاوو wu-aṯṯ-kalāwo; fut. ؤ به اټکلوي wu bah aṯṯ-kalawī; imp. ؤ اټکلوه wu-aṯṯ-kalawah; act. part. اټکلوونکيَ aṯṯ-kalawūnkaey or اټکلوونيَ aṯṯ-kalawūnaey; past part. اټکلوليَ aṯṯ-kalawulaey; verb. n. اټکلونه aṯṯ-kalawunaʿh.
اټه aṯṯaʿh, s.f. (3rd) A ball or reel of thread or cotton; a hank or skein of thread or silk. Pl. ْي ey. Also written اټيه aṯṯe-aʿh and اټيهه aṯṯeh-aʿh, which see.
اټيران aṯṯe-rān, s.m. (2nd) A reel for winding silk, thread, cotton, etc. Pl. اټيرانونه aṯṯe-rānūnah.

اټيرل aṯṯe-ral, verb intrans. To trouble with indigestion; to make dyspeptic. Pres. اټيري aṯṯe-rī; past ؤ اټيره wu aṯṯe-rah; fut. ؤ به اټيري wu bah aṯṯe-rī; imp. ؤ اټيره wu-aṯṯe-rah; act. part. اټيرودنکيَ aṯṯe-rūnkaey or اټيرونيَ aṯṯe-rūnaey; past part. اټيرليَ aṯṯe-ralaey; verb. n. اټيرنه aṯṯe-ranaʿh. See اغیړل اټيرليَ
aṯṯe-ralaey, adj. (past part.) Undigested, crude, dyspeptic. 2. A person troubled with dyspepsia; (Fem.) اټيرل ِ aṯṯe-rali. Pl. (Masc. and Fem.) ‍يِ ī. See اغيړليَ
اټيرنه aṯṯe-ranaʿh, s.f. (3rd) Indigestion, dyspepsia. Pl. يْ ey. See اغيړ
اټيه aṯṯe-aʿh, s.f. (3rd) A ball or reel of thread or cotton, a hank or skein of thread or silk. Pl. يْ ey.
اټيهه aṯṯeh-aʿh, s.f. (3rd) A ball or reel of thread, etc. See preceding. Pl. يْ ey.

A اثبات is̤-bāt, s.m. (2nd) Confirming, corroborating. 2. Confirmation, proof, affirmation. Pl. اثباتونه is̤-bātūnah. اثبات کیدل is̤-bāt kedal or په اثبات رسيدل pah is̤-bāt rasedal, verb intrans. To become corroborated, confirmed, proved. اثبات کول is̤-bāt kawul or په اثبات رسول pah is̤-bāt rasawul, verb trans. To confirm, to corroborate, to prove. See زباد etc.
A اثر as̤ar, s.m. (2nd) A mark, sign, trace, impression, effect. Pl. اثرونه as̤arūnah. اثر کول as̤ar kawul, verb trans. To operate, to take effect, to make impression.
آثره ās̤-raʿh, s.f. (3rd) (corrup. of s آسرا), Asylum, defence, hope, trust, reliance, refuge, shelter, means of defence. Pl. يْ ey.
اڅکه uṯs̱-kaʿh, s.f. (3rd) Dried grapes, raisins. Pl. يْ ey. See وڅکه

اڅنړل aṯs̱aṟṟṉal, verb trans. To level, to make level, to trim, to make even, to reduce or remove inequalities in anything, to reduce to an even surface, to arrange, to place in order, to classify, to regulate, to assign places to. 2. To long stitch, to baste. 3. To tune, to harmonise, to attune, to arrange, to make even. Pres. اڅنړي aṯs̱aṟṟṉī; past ؤ اڅانړه wu-aṯs̱āṟṟṉah; fut. ؤ به اڅنړي wu bah aṯs̱aṟṟṉī; imp. ؤ اڅنړه wu aṯs̱aṟṟṉah; act. part. اڅنړونکيَ aṯs̱aṟṟṉūnkaey or اڅنړنيَ aṯs̱aṟṟṉūnaey; past part. اڅنړليَ aṯs̱aṟṟṉalaey; verb. n. اڅنړنه aṯs̱aṟṟṉanaʿh.
اڅنړليَ aṯs̱aṟṟṉalaey, adj. (past part.) Basted, stitched. 2. Tuned, arranged, made even; (Fem.) اڅنړلِ aṯs̱aṟṟṉali. Pl. (Masc. and Fem.) ‍يِ ī.
A اجابت ijā-bat, s.m. (2nd) Consenting, answering, complying, compliance, consent. Pl. اجابتونه ijā-batūnah. اجابت کول ijā-bat kawul, verb trans. To answer, to comply, to consent to.

A اجاره ijā-raʿh, s.f. (3rd) Hire, rent; income or privilege sold or let for a fixed sum. 2. A farm, a contract. Pl. ْي ey. اجاره دار ijā-raʿh-dār, s.m. (5th) A farmer of land revenue, the holder of a monopoly or contract. Pl. اجاره داران ijā-raʿh-dārān. اجاره کول ijā-raʿh kawul, verb trans. To hire, to rent. اجاره آخستل ijā-raʿh āḵẖistal, verb trans. To take a contract or monopoly.

A اجازت ijā-zat, s.m. (2nd) (inf. IV of جوز) Permission, leave, dispensation, sanction, order. Pl. اجازتونه ijā-zatūnah. اجازت آخستل ijā-zat āḵẖistal, verb trans. To take leave, to take permission. اجازت غوښتل ijā-zat-g̠ẖoḵ́ẖtal (E.), or g̠ẖoś̱ẖtal (W.). verb trans. To ask leave, to request sanction or permission. اجازت ورکول ijā-zat war-kawul, verb trans. To grant permission, to give sanction or dispensation.
A اجر ajar, s.m. (2nd) Retribution, reward of good or bad actions; hire, fare, fee. Pl. اجرونه ajarūnah. اجرو ورکول ajar war-kawul, verb trans. To recompense, to reward.
A اجرت uj-rat, s.m. (2nd) Wages, hire, reward. Pl. اجرتونه uj-ratūnah.

A اجل ajal, s.m. (2nd) The term of life, the hour of death; fate, death. 2. A stated time, delay, respite. Pl. اجلونه ajalūnah. اجل رسيده ajāl rasīdah, adj. Overtaken by fate. اجل نيوليَ ajal nī-walaey, adj. Seized by fate, in the jaws of death. د اجل پياله da ajal pī-ālaʿ, The cup of fate or destiny.
A اجماع ijmāœ, s.f. (1st) (inf. IV of جمع) An assembly, senate, council, a crowd, collection; amount, whole. Pl. اجماع ِ ijmāœi.
A اجمال ij-māl, s.m. (9th) (inf IV of جمل) An abstract, synopsis. Sing. and Pl.
A اجمالي ij-mālī, adj. Abridged, compendious.
A اجناس aj-nās, s. pl. of جنس, which see.
A اجنبي aj-nabī, adj. Foreign, strange, unknown (person). See پرد‍ي
اجوبه ajū-baʿh, s.f. (3rd) Wonder, astonishment, miracle, prodigy. Pl. ْ‍ي ey. See اعجوبه
P آچار āc̱ẖār, s.m. (6th) Pickles. Sing. and Pl.
